channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Near the river, 9th August
item.description:
Sorry Here people they keep feeding birds and make noise and messy on the floor very bad smell These people very crazy and dangerous they are feeding birds very bad smell Thank you

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Grand Union Canal towpath, Maida Vale, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Vegetation needs cutting & waste to be cleared, 9th August
item.description:
Weeds & other vegetation needs cutting. Litter & waste dumped in the same area. Located on grass verge, next to the play area, short walk from Luddesdown House.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 10, Rookery Gardens, Poverest, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rubbish & broken mirror glass, 9th August
item.description:
This has been here for months and it’s dangerous. Lots of shattered mirror glass and close to public park so heavy footfall from children. Also an eyesore and it’s been here such a long time now. This should’ve been cleared up ages ago

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Upper Wickham Lane, Plumstead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flytipping / fire risk under Haberdasher Place flats, 9th August
item.description:
Please can we request this waste is removed as it’s a reoccurring issue (which has previously led to a major fire) that is caused by flytipping

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Pitfield Street, Hackney, London

item.title: Home appliances and construction rubbish dumped, 9th August
item.description:
Wrong is that waste is being dumped weekly at a scale at this point, but council doesn't do anything to install cctv and punish. I'm going to report and complaint about this to wherever its possible - council, MP, PM, Gov. I bought a house, but forced to live in landfill and pay council £200/month. That's disgusting example of inaction. Home appliances and construction rubbish dumped.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Abbey Way, London
Report on FixMyStreet
